text: I order you to suspend all events with more than 100 people in your area from March 13 to March 31, 2020.
The Minister of Infrastructure and Water Management, acting in accordance with the Minister for Medical Care and Sport,

In addition to the earlier instruction, I instruct you to also ensure that all food and beverage outlets, sports and fitness clubs, saunas, seks establishments and coffee shops will be closed from March 15, 2020, 6:00 PM.
Furthermore, I order you to extend the ban on the organization of events and meetings with more than 100 people in your region until April 6, 2020.

Having heard the advice of the Outbreak Management Team and the Administrative Coordination Consultation of 12 March 2020, the Ministerial CommitteeCrisis management decided on March 15, 2020 that from March 16, 2020 to April 6, 2020, no educational activities and no care may be provided in educational institutions and accommodation for childcare and childminders, with some exceptions described below.

Having heard the advice of the Outbreak Management Team and the Administrative Coordination Consultation of March 18, 2020 and an advice from Verenso (Association of specialists in geriatric medicine), the Ministerial Crisis Management Committee of March 19, 2020, in the presence of a representativeof the chairpersons of the safety regions, decided that from 20 March 2020 to 6 April 2020, all nursing homes and small-scale housing in elderly care will be preventively closed for visits and for all others that are not necessary for basic care.

Having heard the advice of the Outbreak Management Team and the Administrative Coordination Consultation of March 23, 2020 and after consultation in the Ministerial Crisis Management Committee of March 23, 2020, I give you on the basis of Article 7 of the Public Health Act, in addition to the earlier instructions in front offight the COVID-19 outbreak, command below.
The instruction I have previously given will be extended from April 7 until April 28, 2020.
In this assignment I have processed and adapted the previous instructions that I have provided to all chairpersons of the security region.
Outdoor sports and exercise
On April 24 and May 8, I instructed you to use your powers in the field of public health and public order and safety totake various measures necessary to combat COVID 19.
Public transport
Secondary education
Primary education
Assessment and practice (targeted) education secondary vocational education and higher education
This also applies to public locations, such as museums, concert halls, theaters and sports clubs and sports competitions.

In view of Article 21 of Regulation (EC) No. 1008/2008 of the European Parliament and the Council of 24 September 2008 on common rules for the operation of air services in the Community (PbEU 2008, L 293) and Article 5.10, first paragraph, part a, of the Aviation Act;
Decides:
Article 1 (definition)In these regulations the following terms have the following meanings:
Covid-19: disease caused by the SARS-CoV-2 virus.
Article 2. (Prohibition of civil air traffic)

1 Om redenen van openbare orde en veiligheid is ter bescherming van de volksgezondheid de uitoefening van burgerluchtverkeer in het luchtruim boven Nederland verboden voor luchtverkeer dat het vervoer van passagiers tot doel heeft, met luchthavens gelegen op Nederlands grondgebied als plaats van bestemming.
2.The prohibition referred to in the first paragraph applies to air traffic from the following countries that pose a high risk in the spread of the virus that causes COVID-19:
2.The prohibition referred to in the first paragraph applies to air traffic from the following countries that pose a high risk in the spread of the virus that causes COVID-19:a. Italy;
2.The prohibition referred to in the first paragraph applies to air traffic from the following countries that pose a high risk in the spread of the virus that causes COVID-19:b. China;
2.The prohibition referred to in the first paragraph applies to air traffic from the following countries that pose a high risk in the spread of the virus that causes COVID-19:c. Iran;
2.The prohibition referred to in the first paragraph applies to air traffic from the following countries that pose a high risk in the spread of the virus that causes COVID-19:d. South Korea;
2.The prohibition referred to in the first paragraph applies to air traffic from the following countries that pose a high risk in the spread of the virus that causes COVID-19:e. Spain;
2.The prohibition referred to in the first paragraph applies to air traffic from the following countries that pose a high risk in the spread of the virus that causes COVID-19:f. Austria.
3 The prohibition referred to in the first paragraph does not apply to:
a. flights as referred to in the first paragraph, which have already started at the time of entry into force;
b. repatriation of EU or Schengen and United Kingdom residents, where:
1 ° non-Dutch residents have a demonstrable transit,
2 ° passengers only in accordance with WHO guidelines and the EU Healthy Gateways, No. 801493, are allowed on board;
c. the transport of medical personnel or patients when this is in the interest of public health.
Exceptions from this instruction are hotels, home-delivered meals and catering.
This also applies to public locations, such as museums, concert halls, theaters and sports competitions.
The locations can and should, where necessary, be used for:
- the organization of distance education, whereby students and pupils receive education in the home situation via a (digital) medium;

- the (emergency) care of children of parents who work in crucial professions or for vital processes, as described on www.rijksoverheid.nl. Emergency shelter is organized by municipalities, supported by the Association of Dutch Municipalities;
- the organization of tests and exams, provided that careful measures have been taken to limit the risk of contamination.

If you find that educational institutions or providers of childcare or childminder care are not complying with this crisis measure and there are persistently more pupils, students or children present at a location than is necessary for the aforementioned purposes, I will instruct you on the basis of Article 7 of the The Public Health Act and with due observance of Article 39, first paragraph, of the Safety Regions Act, to close the educational institution or the accommodation for childcare or childminder care, for example by means of an emergency order.
For enforcement, you can also make use of Article 47 of the Public Health Act.
In the dying phase or comparable circumstances, an institution may occasionally deviate from this measure.
An exception is also possible for structural volunteers.
I take into account that this measure will be extended after April 6, 2020.

On the basis of Article 7 of the Public Health Act and with due observance of Article 39, first paragraph, of the Security Regions Act, I therefore instruct you to use your powers in the field of public order and safety as nursing homes or small-scale housing, despite express efforts on their part, experience problems refusing visitors or third parties attempting to enter the venue.

You must exercise your powers in the field of public order and safety as referred to in Article 39 of the Security Regions Act, including, if necessary, including regulations in an emergency ordinance as referred to in Article 176 of the Municipalities Act. so that the following measures are taken as soon as possible after this designation:
1. Prohibition for all licensed and reporting events until 1 June 2020.
2. Prohibition for all other gatherings, with exceptions for the following gatherings, provided that those involved keep 1.5 meters away from the nearest person at all times:
- legally required meetings, such as meetings of municipal councils, provided that no more than 100 people are present, as well as meetings of the States General;
- meetings necessary for the continuation of the daily activities of institutions, companies and other organizations, provided that no more than 100 people are present
- funerals and weddings, provided that no more than 30 people are present;
- gatherings of a religious or ideological nature, provided that no more than 30 people are present.
- gatherings of a religious or spiritual nature, provided that no more than 30 people are present.
3. Closing casinos, arcades and similar establishments, as well as closing establishments in which contact professions aimed at personal care are practiced, such as hairdressers and nail salons.

4. Prohibition of all forms of contact professions, including masseurs, hairdressers, nail stylists, escort services and driving instructors, insofar as these professions cannot be performed properly with due regard to a distance of 1.5 meters from the customer. The practice of (para) medical professions is excluded, provided there is an individual medical indication for this practice and the practitioner complies with all hygiene requirements in connection with COVID-19.

5. Closure of shops and markets, or termination of public transport, if these facilities do not or not sufficiently comply with the realization of the restrictive measures with regard to keeping 1.5 meters of distance between all persons present in the facility, or to make it clearly visible in an adequate manner.

6. Closure of all forms of locations, including holiday parks, camping sites, parks, nature reserves and beaches, if at these locations not or not sufficiently the restrictive measure with regard to keeping 1.5 meters distance between persons present there is observed or there is a threat of non-observance thereof.
7. Establishing a ban on coincidental or otherwise group formation in (certain parts of) the public space.
Group formation is understood to mean: three or more persons who do not or not sufficiently observe a mutual distance of 1.5 meters.
There is no group formation if it concerns persons who form a joint household.

In addition, there is no group formation if it concerns children up to the age of 12 who play together under the supervision of one or more parents or guardians who observe a mutual distance of 1.5 meters.
You must include the prohibitions referred to under 2 and 3 in an emergency ordinance.
For the measures mentioned under 4 to 7 inclusive, you can make provision in the emergency ordinance, so that action under that ordinance is possible if necessary.
The measures referred to under 2 to 7 will be reconsidered by 6 April 2020 at the latest.
The measures will be reconsidered no later than April 28.
The new assignment concerns the period from April 29 to May 19, 2020.
The instructions mentioned in the footnote) are no longer applicable from April 29, 2020.
The prohibition order for events will be extended until September 1, 2020.
In addition to this designation, on April 17, I issued a separate designation for five security regions with an airport.
There will be a reconsideration no later than the week of May 12, 2020 take place of the measures that apply up to and including 19 May.
The measures are described below in the following appendices:
I. Regulations for events, meetings and failure to observe a safe distance of 1.5 meters
II. Provisions for companies and locations, contact professions and public transport facilities
III. Provisions for educational establishments and residences for childcare, out-of-school care and childminder care
IV Provisions for nursing homes and other small-scale living arrangements in elderly care
I instruct you to add an exception to the earlier prohibition of gatherings;

- Outside sports and exercise for people aged 19 and older is allowed, including in a team. For this age group, as with the age groups up to 19 years, they are not allowed to organize competitions, participate in competitions and for sports and exercise are not allowed to use communal washing  shower facilities.
Naturally, those involved must always keep 1.5 meters away from the nearest person.

The previous exceptions for organized outdoor sports and exercise for children up to and including 18 years also include, under the same conditions (organized, outdoors, 13 to 18 years of age keep their distance), activities of scouting, culture, art , and other youth associations.
Libraries, theme parks and zoos

I am also instructing you to expand the option of exempting shops and markets from the ban on gatherings with libraries, amusement parks and zoos, provided visitors and employees keep a distance of 1.5 meters at all times. to the nearest person.

The managers of these locations are responsible for making plans with which they ensure, among other things, that the 1.5 meters distance is preserved and the burden on the mobility system and in particular public transport remains acceptable.
The general provisions for the closure of food and beverage outlets and terraces will remain in force at these locations until further notice.
The closure of sanitary facilities in these locations only applies to communal washing and shower facilities.
Toilets can be used.

In the follow-up to this instruction, you have the option to close or keep these locations closed if you are of the opinion that the measure to keep 1.5 meters away is (expected) not being properly complied with or cannot be properly observed or that you expect or notice problems with the use of the mobility system and in particular public transport.
Swimming facilities and sports clubs
All swimming facilities can be opened from 11 May.
This means that from 11 May it will also be possible to exercise and exercise in indoor swimming areas.
The managers of the swimming facilities are responsible for ensuring that the measure to maintain a distance of 1.5 meters is properly complied with in and around the swimming facilities.
For swimming facilities, communal washing and shower facilities cannot be used.
Toilets can be used.

I order you to end the closure of swimming areas, but to keep the option to close these locations or keep them closed if you are of the opinion that the measure to keep 1.5 meters away is not is properly observed.
I also order you to make an exception to the closure of establishments for sports and exercise insofar as this is necessary to make outdoor sports possible for persons aged 19 years and older.
Contact professions
As of 11 May, the practice of contact professions is allowed again.
The prohibition on practicing the contact profession still applies to sex workers, they are not yet allowed to practice their profession.
Allowing the exercise of contact professions also means that the establishments where the on body care-oriented contact professions are carried out again fully open and can be used.

Contact professionals and the administrators of establishments where contact professions are exercised are responsible for arranging and organizing the measures necessary to do the work in a careful manner.

I instruct you to keep the option of ceasing to act when in the exercise of contact professions, despite explicit efforts of practitioners and administrators, no 1.5 meters distance is kept between customers and / or visitors.
I now order you to take some measures with effect from 1 June 2020, 12:00 noon and, as far as secondary vocational education and higher education are concerned, 15 June 2020, to be adjusted.
For the rest, the instruction of April 24 and May 8 are extended.
In the week of 1 June 2020, the cabinet will again decide on the extension and / or adjustment of measures.
1.5 meter standard and meetings
A. Part I, section 3, of the designation of April 24, 2020 is replaced by the following:
3. There is a prohibition against not observing a distance of 1.5 meters in public spaces (incl. Vessels and vehicles).
This prohibition applies not if it concerns persons
a) that form a joint household,
b) if it concerns the distance to children up to and including 12 years old, or
c) if it concerns a person with a disability and his companions.
With regard to this prohibition, the 1.5 meters in the public space is enforced from three people.

B.The prohibition on gatherings in the instruction of April 24, part I, part 2, will read as follows:2. Gatherings of more than thirty persons, excluding staff, in buildings open to the public and associated yards and in enclosed places, with the exception of houses, are prohibited.
For meetings of up to thirty people, the parties involved must always keep 1.5 meters away from the nearest person.
The following exceptions to this ban on gatherings apply, provided that those involved keep 1.5 meters away from the nearest person at all times:
a. legally required meetings, such as meetings of municipal councils, provided that no more than 100 persons are present, as well as meetings of the States General;

b. meetings that are necessary for the continuation of the day-to-day activities of institutions, companies and other organizations, including the organization of state exams, provided that no more than 100 people are present.

For shops, markets, libraries, amusement parks, zoos, museums and presentation institutions, an exception can be made from the ban on gatherings, provided that visitors and employees keep 1.5 meters away from the nearest person at all times.

The managers of these locations are responsible for making plans with which they ensure, among other things, that the 1.5 meters distance is maintained and that the burden on the mobility system and in particular public transport remains acceptable.

In the follow-up of this assignment, you have the option to close these locations or keep them closed if you are of the opinion that the measure to keep 1.5 meters away is (expected) not being properly complied with or cannot be properly complied with or that you expect or notice problems with the use of the mobility system and in particular public transport.
C. Where reasonably necessary, vulnerable young people (13-18) among themselves and vulnerable young people with youth professionals may deviate from the 1.5 meter measure in youth aid.
This includes activities in the context of daytime activities, day care, day treatment and special secondary education including transport.
Food and beverage outlets

By way of derogation from part II, part 1 of the designation of 24 April 2020, food and beverage outlets, including terraces, may reopen to guests from 1 June from 12:00 noon under certain conditions.
Dance venues remain closed.
A food and drink facility that also has a dance floor may remain open, provided the dance floor is closed.
A maximum of 30 guests per building may be present in the indoor area of food and beverage outlets.
Within these venues, those present must keep 1.5 meters away, with the exception of persons who form a joint household.
The 1.5 m is maintained from 3 people.
All guests must use a seat at a table or bar.
Guests must book in advance.
Guests must book in advance.
The operator or manager is primarily responsible for compliance with the 1.5 meter and other regulations, as well as for checking them.
Para-commercial food and beverage outlets that are part of outdoor sports facilities (club canteens) will remain closed.
Commercial catering establishments near or on sports facilities may be open to guests under the above conditions.
Outdoor terraces may be open provided that guests have a seat at a table and are kept five feet away, with the exception of persons who form a common household.
The 1.5 m is maintained for 3 people.
The terraces must be completely open at the top or completely open on all three sides.
The operator or manager is primarily responsible for compliance with the 1.5 meters and the other regulations, as well as for checking them.
The same rules apply to terraces in covered shopping centers as to the indoor areas of food and beverage outlets.
The operator or manager must arrange the terrace in such a way that guests and staff can always keep a distance of one and a half meters from each other.
In the case of adjacent terraces, the managers of these terraces jointly ensure that one and a half meters are observed.
From operators or Terrace managers are expected to regulate the influx on the terrace and also prevent clustering of waiting or departing guests outside the terrace.
Food and beverage outlets that are part of establishments that are still closed will remain closed, unless this instruction dictates otherwise.
The chairman of the security region ensures that municipalities draw up an area approach for catering concentration areas to prevent great crowds and influx in these areas.
Cinemas and cultural institutions.

By way of derogation from part I, parts 1 and 2, of the designation of 24 April 2020, cinemas, cinemas, concert halls, stages for all genres of music, theaters and similar cultural institutions may organize activities aimed at the public from 1 June at 12:00 noon.
A maximum of 30 visitors may be present at the same time per individual room within these institutions.
A visibly separated stage is considered a separate space.
All those present must keep a distance of 1.5 meters from each other, with the exception of persons who form a joint household.
Visitors must book in advance.
Museums, presentation institutions and monuments.
Museums, presentation institutions and monuments with a public function may also reopen to visitors from 1 June, 12 noon.
Visitors must book in advance per time slot.

The institutions must organize the admission and residence times and the layout of the institution in such a way that visitors can always keep 1.5 meters away, with the exception of persons who form a joint household.
The provision in II, part 4 of the designation of 24 April will read as follows:
4. As of 1 June, travelers from the age of 13 must wear a non-medical mouth nose mask on public transport.
In practice, enforcement takes place by the transporters designated as supervisors and other supervisors designated under the 2000 Passenger Transport Act.

Termination or limitation of facilities for public transport, in consultation with the transporter, if they do not or insufficiently adhere to the realization of the restrictive measures with regard to wearing a mouth nose mask and keeping a distance of 1.5 meters as much as possible between all persons present in the facility, or to make them sufficiently visible, provided that the termination of this facility does not unnecessarily impede the transport of persons working in vital processes or transport that is otherwise necessary for the mobility of the Netherlands.
The ban on offering educational activities in educational institutions will be lifted for secondary education from 2 June.
Education will be restarted step by step.
Schools for special secondary education and others can open completely again.

The aforementioned educational institutions must take careful measures to limit the risk of contamination, including keeping a distance of 1.5 meters between all persons present in these institutions (as much as possible for secondary special education in special circumstances.
In addition they should ask students to avoid public transport.
Primary education will be fully resumed from 8 June, unless it appears before the spread of the virus is not justified.
The partial ban on opening child and out-of-school care will also lapse.

The prohibition on offering educational activities in educational institutions in secondary vocational education and higher education will be lifted as of 15 June for holding exams, exams, tests, practical (specific) education and supervision of vulnerable students at the educational institution, insofar as this is online. Cannot be sufficient.

A condition for this is that the institutions take careful measures to limit the risk of contamination, including keeping a distance of 1.5 meters between all persons present in these institutions and that students are asked to avoid public transport as much as possible.
The institutions must make agreements with relevant parties about mobility and the use of public transport.
